global:error_invalid_api_data: Invalid data received from the data source's API.
tour:step_date_filter: This is where you can select between which dates should the data be calculated for the graphs, table and rankings.
tour:step_quick_interval: An alternative method of selecting a date interval is by directly picking one of the predefined intervals from the sidebar.
tour:step_country_selection: To select which countries you want added to your charts, check their corresponding boxes from the main table or the ranking tables.
tour:step_view_mode:
Here you can select if you want the combo view (which combines all of the other views) or if you want one of the specific views:

- the Table View contains processed information for all countries plus a "Combined Data" row which combines all of the other rows
- the Rankings View shows a table for each metric with entries sorted in descending order
- the Graph View uses the selected countries and builds tables using the other selected options for graphs
tour:step_graph_mode: This setting allows you to switch between line and bar graphs.
tour:step_graph_metrics: For each of the selected metrics, a new graph will be created.
tour:step_graph_scale: Here you can change the scale between linear and logarithmic. Only works for linear graphs.
tour:step_tour_button:
That's it!
Feel free to press this button if you want to repeat the tour.
graph:metric_info_cases_new: New cases per day for the selected date interval
graph:metric_info_cases_per_capita: New cases per day per million inhabitants for the selected date interval
graph:metric_info_cases_accumulated: Accumulated case evolution for the selected date interval
graph:metric_info_cases_per_capita_accum: Accumulated case evolution per million inhabitants for the selected date interval
graph:metric_info_deaths_new: New deaths per day for the selected date interval
graph:metric_info_deaths_per_capita: New deaths per day per million inhabitants for the selected date interval
graph:metric_info_deaths_accumulated: Accumulated death evolution for the selected date interval
graph:metric_info_deaths_per_capita_accu: Accumulated death evolution per million inhabitants for the selected date interval
graph:metric_info_mortality_percentage: Percentage of new deaths out of the new cases for each day in the selected date interval (daily deaths divided by daily cases)
graph:metric_info_mortality_percentage_a: Accumulated case fatality in the selected date interval (each day represents all deaths until that date divided by all cases until the same date)
table:column_info_selected: Check box to add the country in all the graphs
table:metric_info_cases_new: New cases in the selected date interval
table:metric_info_cases_accumulated: Total cases on the last date of the selected interval
table:metric_info_cases_per_capita: New cases per million inhabitants in the selected date interval
table:metric_info_cases_per_capita_accum: Total cases per million inhabitants on the last date of the selected interval
table:metric_info_deaths_new: New deaths in the selected date interval
table:metric_info_deaths_accumulated: Total deaths on the last date of the selected interval
table:metric_info_deaths_per_capita: New deaths per million inhabitants in the selected date interval
table:metric_info_deaths_per_capita_accu: Total deaths per million inhabitants on the last date of the selected interval
table:metric_info_mortality_percentage: Percentage of new deaths out of the new cases in the selected date interval (new deaths divided by new cases)
table:metric_info_mortality_percentage_a: Accumulated case fatality on the last selected date  of the selected interval (all deaths until that date divided by all cases until the same date)
table:metric_info_population: Based on population data from 2018 (or closest year available)
graph:no_element_selected: No country has been selected to show on the graphs. Please use the checkbox from the first column of the tables in order to select countries.
table:metric_info_rank: Ranking position based on the given metric. Entries with equal values will have the same rank.
